title: Air New Zealand named most reputable company in Australia
title_page: Air New Zealand named most reputable company in Australia | Daily Mail Online
text:
A New Zealand airline has soared to the top of the charts as most the reputable firm in Australia.
Air New Zealand, famed for its attention-grabbing safety videos, beat out Australia's own Qantas for the number one spot on the AMR and the Reputation Institute's Reputation Index.
It was a 'highly unusual' victory according to AMR's managing director, Oliver Freedman, for the 'clearly overseas' company to take a spot on the list.

'While former winner Toyota is an overseas company it has been based in Australia and had manufacturing here,' Mr Freedman told the Australian Finance Review.
'But this is a national airline of another country. It's not even a company that is seen as a global company – it's a true Kiwi company.'
Toyota Motor Corporation came in fourth in the rankings behind electronics giant JB Hi-Fi and Mazda Australia which came in third and second respectively.
Australia's flagship carrier Qantas came in fifth overall, down one place from last year.

Air New Zealand's success is being credited to its strong customer services and an increased marketing presence in Australia, according to Mr Freedman.
'They've created a sense of who they are, they are not just like any other airline,' Mr Freedman said. 'We know that if companies are able to promote a message – for them it's a bit irreverent and a bit humorous – then it can work.'
The airline's interpretations in-flight safety videos have found fame online thanks to their bizarre, engaging themes.

The range of videos includes Sports Illustrated models going through the plane exits and hobbits practicing the safety position to adventurer Bear Grylls stowing away his items.
Perhaps one of their most renowned and elaborate safety videos was themed around the Lord of the Rings film franchise, which was predominately filmed in New Zealand.
